descriptions.labaccess: Makerspace access allows you to work on your own projects at the makerspace.                 You get 24/7 access to the space and you can also store one box with your own things at the space.                 Makerspace Access requires the Base Membership.
descriptions.membership: Base membership gives you voting rights at the yearly meeting, supports your local makerspace, and allows you to attend courses/social events.

errors.no_member_introduction: You must attend a member introduction before you can start an auto-renewal subscription. You can find them in the calendar.

subscriptions.makerspace_access_also_activates_base_su: Activating Makerspace Access Auto-renewal will also activate Base Membership auto-renewal.
subscriptions.next_charge: Your membership will renew at {{formattedDate}} for {{amount}} kr.
subscriptions.pending_makerspace_access: Your {{pending_days}} days of makerspace access will start when you attend a member introduction.

calendar.text: Book a Member Introduction, during which you'll get a tour of the space (if you haven't already) and gain permission to use the makerspace. Your makerspace access will not be activated until you have visited a Member Introduction. In some situations, there may be no available time slots. Please let us know on Facebook or Slack if you cannot book a slot.
calendar.title: Calendar

discounts.apply_for_discounts: I cannot afford the membership fee
discounts.confirmationDiscount: You'll get a {{percent}}% discount on membership.
discounts.confirmationMessage: We understand that not everyone can afford the full price of membership. But there are other ways you can help, if you want to. The Makerspace is run by its members volonteering their time and effort. Join a work day, help out with maintaining a machine, or why not hold a course about something you are excited about?
discounts.messagePlaceholder: Tell us why you need a discount, in at least a few sentences.
discounts.text: If you cannot afford the full price of membership, you can apply for a discount.
discounts.title: Low Income Discounts

memberInfo.phone: Phone (your phone will be used as your key to the makerspace)
memberInfo.title: A little bit about you

memberships.p1: Memberships are split into two parts
memberships.p2: Everyone has the yearly Base Membership, and if you want to work on your own projects, you must also get Makerspace Access (paid monthly).
memberships.title: Makerspace Memberships

success.bookIntroduction: To gain access to the Makerspace you must attend a member introduction. You can book it here, or do it later.

steps.installAccessyWhy: to be able to unlock doors, after your introduction.

success.subTitle: We look forward to meeting you!
success.title: Welcome to the $t(brand:makerspace_name)!

rules:
• keep myself up to date about:
    1. general rules.
    2. rules for storage.
    3. rules for specific rooms that I will be in.
    4. rules for the machines and tools I will use.
  • only visit the space when I have an active makerspace access membership. If my makerspace access membership is not active, I don't have access to the space, except during events like courses, work days, open house, and similar.
  • not engage in commercial activities on the premises.
  • take responsibility for my own actions and to be considerate towards others.
  • store my projects correctly according to current rules. Left-behind materials belong to the association.
  • always try to leave surfaces/machines/tools in better condition than I found them, and to plan my visit to ensure I have time to clean afterwards.
  • not remove equipment from the space.
  • report equipment damage to the board, or on Slack.
  • ask other members, or the board, if I am unsure about something.
  • always ask before I take photos of someone or something at the space.
  • not do anything illegal at the space.
  • not consume alcohol/drugs in the premises and to not use the association's machinery while under the influence.
  • not sleep at the space.
  • take full responsibility for what my guests do at the space. Guests may not work on their own projects during their visit.
  • not use other areas of the building than those that belong to the space. For example AWL's kitchen on the entry floor, if the board has not said otherwise.
terms.title: Rules for the premises
understanding: to handle membership and access to the space, Stockholm Makerspace needs to handle personal information.
if I violate any of the rules above or in any other way misuse my access to the premises, I may be banned from the premises without refund of the paid fee.
I may be liable for compensation if I act negligently.
terms.welcoming: I will do my best to ensure that the Stockholm Makerspace is a clean, safe and welcoming place.
